Module net.automatalib.api
Package net.automatalib.graph.ads

Interface RecursiveADSNode<S,​I,​O,​N extends RecursiveADSNode<S,​I,​O,​N>>

  • Type Parameters:
    S - state type
    I - input alphabet type
    O - output alphabet type
    N - the concrete node type
    All Superinterfaces:
    FiniteRepresentation, Graph<N,​N>, IndefiniteGraph<N,​N>, IndefiniteSimpleGraph<N>, Iterable<N>, SimpleGraph<N>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ADSNode<S,​I,​O>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractRecursiveADSLeafNode, AbstractRecursiveADSSymbolNode, ADSLeafNode, ADSSymbolNode
    public interface RecursiveADSNode<S,​I,​O,​N extends RecursiveADSNode<S,​I,​O,​N>>
extends Graph<N,​N>
    An interface representing a node in an adaptive distinguishing sequence (which essentially forms a decision tree).

    For convenience, this interface extends the Graph interface so that an ADS may be passed easily to the Visualization factory.

    This is a utility interface with a recursive generic type parameter to allow for better inheritance with this recursive data structure. Algorithms may use more simplified sub-interfaces such as ADSNode.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface net.automatalib.graph.Graph

        Graph.IntAbstraction<E>

      • getSymbol

        I getSymbol()
        Returns the input symbol associated with this ADS node.
        Returns:
        the associated input symbol
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if trying to get an input symbol from a leaf node (see isLeaf()).

      • setSymbol

        void setSymbol​(I symbol)
        Sets the input symbol associated with this ADS node.
        Parameters:
        symbol - the input symbol to be associated with this ADS node.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if trying to set an input symbol on a leaf node (see isLeaf()).

      • getParent

        @Nullable N getParent()
        Returns the parent node of this node.
        Returns:
        The parent node of this ADS node. May be null, if this node is the root node of an ADS.

      • getNodesForRoot

        default Collection<N> getNodesForRoot​(N root)
        A utility method to collect all nodes of a subtree specified by the given root node. May be used for the SimpleGraph.getNodes() implementation where a concrete type for RecursiveADSNode is needed.
        Parameters:
        root - the node for which all subtree nodes should be collected
        Returns:
        all nodes in the specified subtree, including the root node itself

      • getChildren

        Map<O,​N> getChildren()
        Returns a mapping to the child nodes of this ADS node.
        Returns:
        A mapping from hypothesis outputs to child ADS nodes. May be empty/unmodifiable for leaf nodes.

      • isLeaf

        boolean isLeaf()
        A utility method indicating whether this node represents a leaf of an ADS (and therefore referencing an automaton state) or an inner node (and therefore referencing an input symbol).
        Returns:
        true if this node is a leaf of an ADS, false otherwise.
